No I said another trooper corrected me saying it was a "Signal" 7 not "Code=
" 10-7 and that not all police departments use the same system here or else=
where.
=A0
=3D)
=A0
Misty
=A0

http://savannahno=

Ancient police language
Signal 7: Shooting
And this:
h=
ttp://www.okcscann er.com/index. php?option=3D com_content&task=3Dview&id=

Signal 7 DOA or dead body 

But you said it was "Code" 7?=



--- On Tue, 5/12/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rastere=
r@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of info=

To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Tuesday, May 12, 2009, 6:10 AM








=
While some codes are used differently, many are used the same.
All the 10 c=
ode references I've found indicate a 10-7 is an out of service.
Can you poi=
nt to a reference that shows a different meaning?

--- On Mon, 5/11/09, Jon=
 <jms480@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Jon <jms480@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [E=
VP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=

Date: Monday, May 11, 2009, 8:17 PM





There are general set of 10 codes=
 that recommended and published for people listing to emergency services ra=
dio bands as a go by.=A0 Many departments customize the 10 codes for their =
department, so from location to location the codes don't always mean the sa=
me thing.=A0 When multiple departments are working together Home Land Secur=
ity recommends that to eliminate possible misunderstandings, 10 codes shoul=
d not be used.

=A0
Regards,
Jon in Texas
=A0






From: Rj <rasterer@yaho=
o. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Monday, May 11, 2009 8:08:33 AM
=
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The Seven - interesting tidbit of info








Code =
7 is either code for being out of service (short for 10-7), or a meal break=
:

http://www.radiolab s.com/police- codes.html
http://www.yougetin fo.com/=
info/ PolCodes. html


--- On Sun, 5/10/09, Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.=
com> wrote:


From: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] =
The Seven - interesting tidbit of info
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: S=
unday, May 10, 2009, 9:31 PM









Tonight at work I was talking to a st=
ate trooper, there had been an accident. I asked him if there were any deat=
hs (it was very very bad) and he said he didnt know so he got on his radio =
and called in and asked them if it was a 7 at the site. They told him negat=
ive, and he told me the little boy who was the worst off was still alive. I=
 asked him why did you ask them if it was a 7. He said code 7, I was asking=
 them if they were dead. So if you ever hear anyone call 7 over the radio t=
hat means someones dead.
=A0
Just thought I would pass that on. I find it i=
nteresting since I know alot of us have heard this before when used to desc=
ribe who is speaking rather than a name they say seven.
=A0
Misty









=
